definition: vivid and colorful (idiom); true to life/lively and realistic
to draw/to paint
sound/voice/tone/noise/reputation/classifier for sounds
to draw/to paint
color/dice
color/CL:種|种[zhong3]/look/appearance/sex

sentences.english: Vivid description of the teacher to read these words up.
sentences.chinese: 说罢老师就绘声绘色地读了起来。

sentences.english: The boy talked in an animated way about his trip to the jungle.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩绘声绘色地谈著他的热带丛林之行。

sentences.english: A piece of juicy gossip is going the rounds.
sentences.chinese: 一条绘声绘色的小道消息正在传来传去。

sentences.english: The visitors also made a promise to the United States to describe a reporter twin cities story.
sentences.chinese: 这位美国客还绘声绘色地给记者描述了一个双城故事。

sentences.english: The speechmaker  dramatized his story with many gestures and actions.
sentences.chinese: 演讲人用很多手势和动作绘声绘色地描述他的故事。

sentences.english: She gave a thrilling account of her life in the jungle.
sentences.chinese: 她绘声绘色地描述了她在热带丛林中的生活。

sentences.english: The boy talks in an animated way about his trip to the jungle.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩绘声绘色地谈著他的热带丛林之行。

sentences.english: People talked about it vividly, as if they had all experienced it themselves.
sentences.chinese: 人们说得绘声绘色，仿佛都亲自经历过一样。

definition: (of a singer etc) excellent in voice and expression (idiom)
lit. to add oil and vinegar/fig. adding details while telling a story (to make it more interesting)
smiles of exultation/radiant with delight
to speak in a pleasant and captivating manner (idiom)
to add interest (to a story)/to sex up
unceasing torrent (idiom)/talking non-stop/gabbling forty to the dozen
mouth like a torrent (idiom)/eloquent/glib/voluble/have the gift of the gab
lit. count by fives and tens (idiom); to narrate systematically and in full detail
with keen interest (idiom)/with great pleasure/with gusto/eagerly
to make a show of being very much in earnest (idiom)/to act as if one is taking things very seriously
living spirit, living image (idiom); true to life/vivid and realistic
see 煞有介事[sha4 you3 jie4 shi4]
overjoyed (idiom); as pleased as punch
lit. to quote the classics/to quote chapter and verse (idiom)
without missing a word
endlessly interesting (idiom)/very witty
